questions.question_text:
Dreamscape Flowers needs to create a digital experience that meets the following requirements:
It allows for collaboration between customer and partner users.
Self-service for customer users is available.
Partner users create or resolve cases for their customers and need to see case data on a dashboard.
Partner users do not manage Leads, Opportunities, or Campaigns.
Which license type should a Salesforce Admin use for these partner users?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
・"Partner users need to see case data on a dashboard" means the users need Customer Community Plus or Partner Community Licenses.
・"Partner users do not manage Leads, Opportunities, or Campaigns." means the users do not need Partner Community license functions.

Selected Answer: D
Cases and Dashboards are included in Customer Community Plus, Partner Community and Channel Account licenses. Leads, Opportunities, or Campaigns are not required and these objects are only included in the Partner Community and Channel Account licenses. So the only option is Customer Community Plus.

questions.question_text:
Ursa Major Solar would like content from Salesforce CMS to be queried when users search for keywords in its customer portal.
Which setting must be turned on in order for Global Search in Experience Builder to query content in Salesforce CMS?

choices.C: Search must be enabled for the selected CMS Channel.
choices.B: Gather Customer Insights Data must be selected.
choices.A: Sharing Rules must be set to Read/Write.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C. Search must be enabled for the selected CMS Channel.

Enabling search for the selected CMS Channel ensures that content from Salesforce CMS can be indexed and queried when users search for keywords in the customer portal. This setting allows content stored in Salesforce CMS to be included in search results returned by the Global Search functionality within Experience Builder.

Selected Answer: C
'Enable search for your Salesforce org’s channels in the CMS Channels tab and get your users to the CMS content they need.' https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.community_managed_content_search_content.htm&type=5

questions.question_text:
Ursa Major Solar would like its authenticated external users to be able to search for Quote and Contract objects but not Opportunity or Asset objects.
Which two standard features allow an administrator to accomplish that? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
The two standard features that allow an administrator to accomplish this are:

**A. Remove Opportunity and Asset from the object list in the Global Search Results component property editor.**

**C. Remove Opportunity and Asset from the Autocomplete object list in the Search component property editor.**

These options would prevent the Opportunity and Asset objects from appearing in search results and autocomplete suggestions, respectively. This way, authenticated external users would not be able to search for these objects. Option B and D are not directly related to search functionality. They deal with navigation and display, but not with the ability to search for specific objects.

choices.D: Remove Opportunity and Asset from the Tile Menu component in the property editor.
choices.C: Remove Opportunity and Asset from the Autocomplete object list in the Search component property editor.
choices.B: Remove Opportunity and Asset from the Navigation Menu component in the property editor.
choices.A: Remove Opportunity and Asset from the object list in the Global Search Results component property editor.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Partner Community Plus indeed does not exist. Here is the list of available licences: https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=sf.users_license_types_communities.htm&type=5

Selected Answer: C
Partner Community Plus is not one of the available Experience Cloud User Licenses.
"Partner Community License - Business-to-business experiences that need access to sales data such as partner relationship management."

Selected Answer: C
C. Partner Community

The Partner Community license is suitable for external partners, such as retailers, who need to collaborate with UC on business opportunities, including registering deals and working together on sales conversions. This license provides partners with access to collaboration tools, deal registration functionality, and resources within the community to support their sales efforts.

Selected Answer: C
Partner Community Plus does not exist.

questions.question_text:
Universal Containers (UC) works with a large retailer network. UC wants these retailers to start registering deals and work with UC to convert them into sales.
Which user license should the Experience Cloud consultant recommend?

A consultant is setting up an experience for a client in a new org. The client insists on using standard profiles for external users.
Which step is required in order to use standard profiles in a site?

choices.A: Customer Community Plus Login Experience licenses need to be used.
choices.C: Ensure the standard profiles have “Allow using standard external profiles for self-registration, user creation, and login” set to True.
choices.D: Create a permission set with “Allow standard external profiles” checked and assign to all external users.
choices.B: “Allow using standard external profiles for self-registration, user creation, and login” must be enabled.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
'To allow self-registration and user creation using standard external profiles, go to Setup | Communities Settings and enable the new Allow standard external profiles for self-registration and assignment to users preference.' https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=release-notes.rn_networks_standard_external_profile_cruc.htm&release=224&type=5
